results.title: Sonata in Brussels
results.brief_description: A portrait of life in a capital city. the noise of a crowd swarming around a city hotel is offset by the cooing of pigeons in the bird market; the mute dialogues in the parks, the clamour of the flea circus; the traffic jams, the whistle of the policeman which hypnotises the mannequins in a shop window; the cries of the street urchins; the music of the city. Without commentary.

results.title: Somewhere in India
results.brief_description: The ravages of malaria in India and the work being done by the World Health Organisation in close collaboration with the Indian Government in combating the disease. Music by Ravi Shankar.

results.title: Somewhere in France: in search of the ANZACS
results.brief_description: Designed to help students become more aware of the history around them, this video and guide provides students with an excellent primary source kit of Australian experiences of the Great War; as told through the experiences of Australian soldiers.

results.title: Sometimes I must speak out strongly
results.brief_description: This program documents the impact of the Indonesian invasion of East Timor. It particularly focuses on the role of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo. He believes that he should be outspoken about the atrocities suffered by the people of East Timor because of the Indonesian occupation. The video comments on the feelings of East Timorese people and attitudes and methods of control used by the Indonesians. The format consists of film footage depicting life in East Timor: a commentary and interviews with Bishop Belo, the Indonesian General Herman Mantiri and East Timorese people. Suitable for Middle-Upper Secondary students. A longer version of this program is held in the collection as title: A Portrait of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo

results.title: Something to work for
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold, Roundtable Productions and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Focuses on the problem of motivation from the management point of view. Reveals what happens when demands are high, when communication is open, and when people are given support and encouragement in reaching common goals.

results.title: Something to say (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Moorabbin College of TAFE, CRS, CSV and Raffi Ghazarian
results.brief_description: Four young adults in their early 20s who are deaf come together to view a video that was made of them six years earlier. They reflect on their past and describe their lives over the years since. They talk about their families, their work, and their special interests. Through this discussion, and re-enactments, we learn about the things they have discovered in their transition from school to adult life, their feelings and experiences, and the things that they would like to say to young deaf students, their teachers and parents, and the community at large.

results.title: Something Pacific
results.brief_description: Nam June Paik’s Something Pacific (1986) is made up of TVs buried in the grass outside and an interactive video wall within the building at the University of Southern California San Diego’s Media Center and is part of the Stuart Collection.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.
